reviews.text: Deliciosas enchiladas. Su personal muy amable y por mi compra me regalaron un delicioso postre de pastel de ma√≠z :)
felt like a family atmosphere
Such an amazing restaurant. Dinika is a great server amazing energy. Camilo made such amazing drinks. Food was 10 out of 10.
Amazing service Dinika was amazing, super attentive and took great care of us! The bartender Camilo was also amazing!!
Such a vibey place. Dinika & Camilo was such great service people. I love this place and always come back! Give this place a cisit for sure
Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience. Would recommend every single time.
Dinika was incredible for our party of 20+ post NYC marathon. Could not ask for better service! If you‚Äôre looking for a place for your big gathering this is the place to celebrate together!
Was a great time and the margaritas were great!!
Dinika knows what‚Äôs up

My friends and I came in 25 strong for a celebratory dinner after the NY marathon and though it was obviously tight, they made it work and got us sat super quickly. The food was a 10 and the margaritas were a lot of fun! We got a few pitchers, all different flavors and none of them disappointed. Shoutout to Dinika, our server, who played Table Tetris to fit us in and made us feel right at home.
Came to eat after nyc marathon and the vibes were great! Dinika served our table of 20 like an expert! Kept us topped of with drinks and food all night!
Dinika was amazing! Great service for hosting a 20 people party ü©∑‚Ä¶
Best experience in NYC!! Amazing service and food and they make you feel like family! 10/10 would recommend
Dinika was amazing, we had the best time! Came here with a big group and was so impressed with how incredible every aspect was!
Amazing authentic Mexican food in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen. Food and drinks were fresh and tasty!! Freshest salsa we‚Äôve ever had!
Good food and fast service. They are very attentive to their customers. Would recommend.
Incredible chips and salsa!!

I can‚Äôt believe they have the audacity to charge $10 for a quesadilla that‚Äôs the size of one of those frozen personal pizzas from the grocery store cut into six minuscule pieces. On top of that, it took about 15 minutes to make! Really? I should‚Äôve just gone to Taco Bell and got twice the quesadilla for half the price and in half the time.
Drinks were good, the guacamole was above standards and the salsa was top tier. My server was super nice and easy to talk to. I'll be coming back.

Mamasita for the Win! Delicious Mexican inspired food. Widest array of Margarita flavors I've ever seen, and tasty with the right amount of alcohol. Lol! Great service, and a welcoming vibe. Good Music and the Owner personally checks on you to ensure you are pleased.
I love this place!
Great food , safe and comfortable space
Delicious food, great atmosphere and service. Family owned and ran.
Great food and service. Friendly owners. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

The drinks were good. But there are definitely fishy reviews here, its not 4.7 star restaurant by anyones interpretation, as many other reviewers have pointed out.

The food is mid 2 star (at best). Takes quite a long time to bring the food, and it leaves alot to be desired. Far better mexican in nyc. If this place was true 4.7 star it would be packed, and it isnt. The guac says fresh on the menu, but it looked and tasted like store bought and was not freshly made. Portions were small for the price.

The service was fine. Vibe was ok. They charge 4% for credit card which is rich, especially taking into account the already expensive prices for the quality of food.

Its not bad, but i was expecting MUCH MORE based on the rating. 2 star food. 4 star drinks. 3 star prices. Would not recommend and won't be returning.
Food was amazing. Service was great.
Absolutely delicious food. Fresh guacamole and salsa was so good and flavorful. The meals were filling and hot and the flavor was top tier.
Great restaurant in Manhattan - great Mexican food in authentic atmosphere! Always worth to come back.

We had a great experience here on our first night in NYC. Wanted some good authentic Mexican food and this fit the bill. We had a reservation, but didn't really need one. Sat down right away. It was very loud, so a conversation was a bit difficult, but besides that, it was delicious food and very nice staff. We were even offered free dessert, but we were stuffed and had to pass. Very casual place, so if you're in the mood for good Mexican food and a non-pretentious environment, then this is the place for you.

We came to this restaurant a few years ago and loved it and after moving into the area, we decided to enjoy it again. The food was absolutely delicious and extremely vegetarian friendly! We were able to find so many options to accommodate our dietary needs. And the best part is they do Jain food too for those who don‚Äôt eat onion/garlic etc. The service was amazing and quick. After the owner found out my husband and I just got married, he sent us a delicious tres leches cake on the house. Overall, I was so happy we chose to come here for dinner and can‚Äôt wait to be back!
Sehr gutes Esses und freundliche Bedienungüòä
Good food! Great atmosphere!
Very nice mexican foodüòç
Food and drinks were delicious!
Food and drinks were amazing!

This is definitely a spot that if I lived in NY I would be a frequent visitor! The ambience felt like home. The food was good! And Danika, my waitress was very accommodating to my needs with an infant. The food and the margarita were made fresh!

Thank you Danika for the hospitality!
The margaritas are just FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!!!!! Seasonal menu for Halloween is seriously to ~die~ for üëª
Amaaazing

Great restaurant! Food was tasty and great for all allergens. There was a lot of vegetarian options. Also there is an extensive margarita menu with some holiday flavors for Halloween which was great as well. Staff is helpful and friendly. I would recommend
Fantastic margaritas!!
Amazing experience! Delicious margaritas and incredible service
This place is perfect to grab food and drinks before a concert at Terminal 5 ‚Äî take it from me right now getting food and drinks before a concert to Terminal 5 ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Come here before your show at terminal 5 for $40 marg pitchers!
The food is amazing I definitely recommend all my family and friends
Amazing place, owner has been here for 40 years and still makes time to greet you and not to mention the food and drinks are delicious and strong
Great food and great margs. Would absolutely come again.
Margs are delicious !
Great food and drinks!
The food is delicious, staff is amazing and the owner is so sweet!!
Great food and friendly staff!!
The food and drinks were absolutely delicious!! The staff was very accommodating, and their specialty meals and drinks were to DIE for!

A casual Mexican food restaurant. The guacamole is really great! The shrimp enchilada is quite good, although I asked if it could be made hot, and was just bland (I sought help from Valentina's sauce).

Overall, nice for a snack on the way, nothing to change your route for.

Good morning! I highly recommend this restaurant for the warmth and kindness of the staff, as well as the quality of the food. Even though we arrived quite late, they welcomed us in and treated us with great care. The service was excellent, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was charming and authentic. I truly recommend it!

I came here after work for happy hour drinks with my girlfriends. The vibes were amazing and the prices were right. Dinika provided such great and knowledgeable service, and had such good recommendations for drinks and food. PK was so welcoming and fun! They had such fun season cocktails. We will definitely be back!!

Food was great, servers were very pleasant and friendly, we met the owner, PK, who sat down at our table after our dinner. Our conversation with PK out our visit over the top. This was my first visit to NY City and meeting PK and eating at his restaurant made the trip memorable. This place is a hidden gem. A must if you love Mexican food. We will definitely be back.

Mamasita Bar and Grill in NYC is a hidden gem! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîfrom the flavorful tacos to the perfectly spiced enchiladas. Their margaritas were super refreshing, just what we needed to go with our meal. What truly stood out was the warm and accommodating service; both the staff and the owner made us feel so welcome. A must-visit spot for authentic Mexican food in the city!

The service was hands down perfect. I forget the lady‚Äôs name but she made it.

It‚Äôs hard to find good margsritas in nyc. But these stand. You can taste the alcohol. Love the fresh fruit ones personally. Frozen or fresh I ordered both.

The food we had was good too however thru salsa is bad. Served small and my biggest let peeve is they charge for chips. Thats so stupid when we r spending hundreds.  If people order alcohol. They should get free chips. It would be 5 stars otherwise

Love the vibe of this place. Small, cozy, local feel, nice bar, etc. Big menu, both food and drink.

There is an extensive vegetarian (and vegan, if needed) menu. Two of the three of us who went for dinner are vegetarian and were thrilled with so many choices.

The margarita menu is also extensive. Many kinds of margarita variations and types of tequila. You then need to choose your size from a 12 oz, 16 oz, up to punchbowls of margaritas. No, I‚Äôm not kidding.

The service was friendly and excellent.

The food was good to very good. Worth trying again. We started with the queso, which was different than others I‚Äôve had in the past. Less cheesy and included beans. Recommended! We ate the Tex Mex burrito, some enchiladas, and the chicken enchiladas with brown mole sauce. I would have liked more sauce on/in my burrito. The filling was tasty cooked perfectly.

Local find in a part of town that‚Äôs more and more overrun with new places.

Das Essen war ok, aber zu teuer! Die Karte ist viel zu gro√ü. Was ich pers√∂nlich gar nicht mag, wenn man einem die ganze Zeit anfasst und schon gar nicht, wenn man mir in die Haare fasst! Der Chef war uns zu aufdringlich.

Came because of the reviews. Food took 45mins when it wasn‚Äôt even busy. Service was horrible. Also not even authentic Mexican. For the portion of what they were charging was ridiculous. Also they charged 4% for credit card plus tip 20% was added when we were a party of 2. We venomed to some Indian gentleman to avoid the 4% cc charge. HIGHLY do not recommend at all. Very disappointed.

(Photo below is their nacho supreme with shredded chicken that cost $20‚Ä¶size is unbelievably small lol)

You can‚Äôt go wrong with this place. THE BEST MARGARITAS!!!! And so many options I think I have to come couple of more times to get them all and of top of that they have the seasonally drinks available and makes it so hard to decide for one. Chef PK thank you for being so kind and for the attention. Food and rinks on point.

Treated so nicely from the moment I walked into the restaurant.  Loved the atmosphere and great recommendations.  The margaritas are so damn good!  The quesadilla with ground beef had so much flavor!

Thank you for treating me so kindly ‚ù§Ô∏è

I loved every moment of our visit here. This is a nice diamond in the rough spot. I wasn't sure what to expect when we arrived, but that quickly changed.

The owner greeted us and was super attentive and courteous.

The restaurant is small and when busy it can get a bit tight. However, typically, other patrons are understandable and helpful with letting others by.

The drinks are AMAZING. We opted for the smaller sizes because we wanted to sample different flavors, so we did 3 margaritas each. Let me just say that the margaritas were poured with a heavy hand and were greatly appreciated. I made it home from the restaurant to the Northeast section of the BX and was still feeling my buzz heavily. So, yes, the drinks are worth the hype and price.

The food was good and tasty, but I was a bit disappointed with the portion sizes. However, it's important to note that I wasn't still starving after eating, but for the prices, I expected a little more.

Overall, my only downfall is that we hadn't visited this place sooner. I for sure know we will definitely be returning soon.

I cannot believe it took me a years to find this place so close to me :) Great margaritas and food.  Family owned for decades.  Thanks Dinika for great suggestions and service!  We will be back.  Oh, the dessert margaritas are delicious üòã

We had such a great experience at Mamasita Bar & Grill! Chef and owner PK was so warm and welcoming ‚Äî he personally came over to our table, introduced us to Victoria beer (a perfect pairing with the food), and made us feel right at home. The food itself was excellent, full of flavor and clearly made with care. Between the great hospitality and amazing dishes, this spot is a real gem in NYC. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

I had a blast at Mamasita bar and Grill! Our server, Luna was an absolute pleasure and she prepared the most delicious frozen passionfruit margarita. I paired this with their ribeye steak and mushroom fajita platter and it was out of this world. Definitely come in and check out this midtown classic

0/5 stars if I could. I don‚Äôt usually leave negative reviews for small businesses, but this one is well-deserved. Beware: the glowing reviews here seem fake ‚Äî possibly generated through a review app.

I came for lunch and ordered a burrito and a drink. My total, with tax, was $39. They then added $7.50 as ‚Äúgratuity,‚Äù plus another $3 charge with no explanation. Final bill? $49 ‚Äî nearly a 40% tip. To make it worse, they crossed out the tip section as if I did it ‚Äî I did not.

And the food? Disgusting. I was starving and still couldn‚Äôt finish it. I regret not speaking up sooner, but hopefully this helps someone else avoid the same mistake.

The business responded to me and said I exaggerated by saying they took it upon themselves to add a 40% tip, even though I posted the receipts and it CLEARLY SHOWS WHAT WAS DONE. THEY TOOK IT UPON THEMSELVES TO ADD A 10 dollar tip as you can see my bill with tax was 39 dollars and I walked out paying 49‚Ä¶ Again please beware. And you can always report them to the better business bureau for stealing!

The restaurant is small but has massive character. Beautiful Mexican atmosphere with absolutely wonderful staff. They happily accommodated our party of seven as a walk up.

The food was great. The guacamole was excellent and highly recommend it. Signature margaritas were a little expensive but they tasted great. Tacos were amazing and the chimichanga was on point.

A gem of Hell‚Äôs Kitchen, family run and run well. A must stop if looking for Mexican food in the heart of New York City.

Mamasita is our new go-to neighborhood spot for amazing Mexican food in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen. From the moment you walk in, the vibe is warm, welcoming, and full of energy. The service is super friendly and attentive, and the food never disappoints!

If you're looking for great food, service, and margaritas go to Mamasita Bar & Grill...easy to get to...We ordered chips and guacamole to start. Very fresh made with the topnotch ingredients! We ordered traditional margaritas made with Herradura tequila on the rocks. There are numerous margarita choices! Ours was deliciously smooth! A sure bet was the mamasita black bean soup- -it will not disappoint your taste buds. Very fresh and tasty! In my opinion, one of the best soups ever!!! I highly recommend. My hubby had chicken enchiladas filled with lots of veggies, and seasoned grilled chicken! Nice presentation.

We also had the pleasure of meeting the owner! We struck up a conversation and asked about the challenges. He shared his firsthand knowledge of running a successful restaurant! He is proud of his loyal chefs and staff.

One of the best Mexican restaurants in NYC! The queso with beef and guacamole were excellent starters and the chicken tacos didn‚Äôt disappoint! The staff were very attentive to replenishing the warm chips and the superb salsa. There are numerous gluten free options that are all clearly labeled on the extensive menu. Their variety of margaritas is unmatched and, while I loved the Sherry Berry (fresh cranberries, strawberries and raspberries), I look forward to returning so I can try more flavors! Pictured is a s‚Äômores margarita!

My friends and I had such a GREAT time  at mamasitas. The margaritas were tasty and the owner was such a ball of energy. He was super attentive and the margaritas hit the spot. Food was delicious and savory. Love the back story on how they've been in business for 42 years. Im from NJ and I'll definitely come back after my first experience.

If you‚Äôre searching for the absolute best Mexican food in New York City, look no further than Mamasita in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen. This restaurant is a true gem! From the moment you walk in, the owner, P.K., will greet you with warmth and genuine hospitality that immediately makes you feel welcome. The service  staff was friendly, courteous, and attentive.

The food was absolutely delicious. Every dish is crafted with the freshest, highest-quality ingredients and bursting with authentic flavor. The nachos, guacamole, and chicken fajitas are excellent and highly recommended.

In addition to the food and service being amazing, the atmosphere is relaxed and inviting, making it the perfect spot for anything from a casual dinner with friends to a special night out.

This restaurant sets the gold standard for Mexican cuisine in NYC. Exceptional food, top-notch service, and an overall experience that has kept me and my wife coming back again and again. Absolutely five stars!

I am surprised I had not visited sooner. I stopped in to grab a simple bite on my way back home from work, and I was warmly greeted by both the owner and the attentive staff, which set a positive tone for my experience.

I opted for the mixed fajitas, accompanied by chips and salsa ‚Äî The flavors were simple yet delicious, while it was interesting to find broccoli in the fajitas!  I thought it added a nice mix and texture to the dish.

The service was exemplary; my waitress was friendly and ensured that my dining experience was enjoyable.

If you‚Äôre looking for a quick yet delicious bite with a local, family-welcoming atmosphere, this is the place to stop by!  I look forward to visiting again for another comfort meal after work. Thank you for being in my neighborhood !

Awesome food, atmosphere, and service! This place was recommended to us by a friend and didn‚Äôt disappoint. Some of the best enchiladas I‚Äôve eaten in NYC! Family owned for 40+ years and you can tell they care about your experience.

Our new favorite Mexican place in NYC! Homemade chips (warm) and salsa were exceptionally good. Margaritas (like spicy) were great. Family run for decades. Some of the nicest people behind the bar. So good!
Amazing margaritas, food was so awesome. Highly recommend for locals and out-of-towners. Authentic Mexican food. Great service. So many gluten free options!
The margaritas are amazing and I love that they have so many flavors! Food is great too and so is service.

PK at Mamasita made us feel like part of the family during dinner. Service was quick and friendly. The drinks are delicious. Food was delicious and I left feeling delightfully full. I got the authentic chicken platter with garlic sauce (recommended by PK) and it was mouthwatering. I was also pleased to find out the chicken was organic. Will definitely come back again when I‚Äôm in the area. Thank you, Mamasita!

My new favorite Mexican spot in the city!!! I will be coming back all the time. Amazing family-owned vibes and the food and drinks are exceptional. Dinika served us and she is the best! Highly recommend

Mamasita Restaurant is truly one of the best hospitality spots you can visit. The owners are incredibly welcoming and bring such warmth and energy to the experience. Their spirited approach, along with their daughter leading the way, creates a family-oriented atmosphere that makes you feel right at home.

The food, service, and overall vibe make it a place worth returning to again and again. I will definitely be coming back!

Came here because my friends and I were still hungry after dinner. We got the seafood quesadilla and guac and chips, and they were so yummy! The owner was so nice and went around to make sure we enjoy the food. Atmosphere is great. I'd definitely come back to try their margaritas some time. Would recommend for vibes

Great service, great food. Many vegetarian options. Choose the veggie chilaquiles. Delicious! Family owned and operated. They really care about customer satisfaction. Also..25+ margarita flavors. Coming back to try all of them!

First time visiting New York from the UK and wanted the authentic American Mexican experience and I wasn't disappointed the food andatmosphere was fantastic! And was able to have my first Chimichanga! Would definitely recommend!!

The wait staff was wonderful. Very attentive and helpful. The food was, unfortunately, nothing special. The portions were decent but the flavor was lacking. On the chicken fajitas I did enjoy that it was grilled just right without it being dry but the seasoning was not there. The chicken enchiladas were decent no complaints there. The guac for my personal taste was too chunky and no flavor. Overall I would say with so many Mexican options in Manhattan alone I would personally pass on this one.

PK and wife Bina were very hospitable! Made us feel very welcome! The food was amazing!  We had the combo plate, 2 burritos 1 chicken and 1 steak and a pork taco! Sakai was so fresh and delicious!  Highly recommend!

My wife and I came here before a Broadway show and we are so glad we did. The drinks were 10/10. The food was 10/10. The service was 10/10. The waitress and the owner were both fantastic. We are both vegetarian and had a ton of options, and they took my peanut and tree nut allergy very seriously. We will absolutely be back!

My date and I happened upon this lovely restaurant after a concert at Lincoln Center. We were impressed by the drinks (margaritas, lots of Mezcal options), and the food. There were some vegan and vegetarian options on the menu, and it was very tasty. The service was excellent as well. Recommended!

The food is great. The margaritas are great as well with fresh fruit options.

The biggest surprise is the automatic 20% tip, which is usually for large group and at least mentioned somewhere on the menu. And it is not the case here.

We have officially found our fave mexican restaurant in hell's kitchen and midtown! Everyone here is so nice, from the owner PK to our fave server behind the bar Dani. The vibe is super chill and fun, and the food is awesome. We'll start with the chips and salsa - this salsa is one of the best we have had, perfectly spiced and nice and onion-y and the chips are very fresh. The chicken fajitas are awesome as well. Oh and the margaritas are huge and delicious. Go!
Go for the delicious food; come back for the excellent customer service. Warm, welcoming, family vibe that makes you feel at home before the chips even arrive.

This small restaurant has been in this location and owned by the same family for over 40 years!Skinny margarita was delicious as were the tacos.  The fresly made guacamole was the best I have ever tasted.  As normal for NYC,  it was not cheap but was worthy of the price.
The sizzling vegetable fajitas were 10/10! Service was incredible! Flan was also really good!
The food is phenomenal and the drinks were just as great. The atmosphere was very chill. It felt like a great local place we could often frequent.
Best margaritas in NYC! Vibe is immaculate and staff is super friendly. Food is always so tasteful and location is perfect!

I heard about this place through a post on Instagram. I was expecting a larger sized restaurant, but it turned out to be a nice little hole in the wall kind of joint. I went on a Sunday afternoon without a reservation, and I was able to get a table immediately. The young lady who waited on me from behind the bar was very friendly, and she could serve up a great Pina Margarita. It was so good that I got two. The service getting my food order was a tad slow, but once I was served, everything tasted great. I ordered the jalapeno poppers and the pescado veracruz, and both had great flavors. Even though the rice and beans that came with my entree looked plain, it tasted good as well. I also got complementary chips and salsa for the table. They have a pretty extensive food and drinks menu with different flavored margaritas, and everything is reasonably priced. The restaurant is kept pretty clean, and all tables are wiped down after patrons leave. I enjoyed my first dining experience here, and I will stop in again the next time I pass through the area.
